result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Victor Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

superMiscConds.notes: State to file claim within 90 days.
Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV system.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.
Defendant shall continue with seizure medications and treatment and not terminate without physicians approval.

Plea/sentencing Hearing
2/10/17
Associated with Charge #2

Special Prosecutor Tara Jenswold present
Attorney Raymond Edelstein present
Defendant present
Plea - no contest - count 2
Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant found guilty of count 2
Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in
State is in compliance with victim notifications
Statements by victims Mother, Sister, Father, Daughter and Sister
Statements by the defendant's son
Recommendations by counsel
10:06 am - recess taken by the Court
10:19 am - Statements by Attorney Jenwsold regarding restitution
Further recommendations by counsel
Statements by defendant
Statements by the Court
Sentenced to 9 years in the Prison system with 3 years of initial confinement followed by 6 years extended supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:
Pay costs - apply cash bond and hold remainder for restitution
Pay restitution - state to file claim within 90 days
Submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations
Shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in chapter 961
Shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the DMV
Shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system
Shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood
Possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician
Obtain prescription from one pharmacy and notify agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions
Supply a biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis
DL revoked 5 years - outside of extended supervision
Continue with seizure meds and treatment and not terminated without physicians approval
Advised of appeal rights
Advised of firearm/voting body armor restrictions
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Restriction on Firearm Possession
